intro: Amsinckia granulosa, commonly known as the sticky fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert and semi-desert environments. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds that contribute to its spread across arid regions. Amsinckia granulosa is also known for its sticky secretions, which can adhere to animals and clothing.
